availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James E. Miller (Calloway County, KY, attorney)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, attorney. South Carolina native. Son of Joseph Miller and Mary Jones Miller. Married to Mary H. Miller. Father of Mary M. Miller. Resident of Calloway County, Kentucky, in 1850. Graduated from the Law Department of the University of Louisville in Louisville, Kentucky, in February 1860. Attorney in Calloway County in 1860. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from January 30, 1862, to May 12, 1864. Reported as deserted from Pulaski County on May 12, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 464A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, Murray, p. 189.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, Murray, p. 86B.
Catalogue of the Officers and Students in the Law Department of the University of Louisville (Louisville: Hull & Brother, Printers, 1860), 17.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0258.
"James Erwin Miller (1839-1876)," Find A Grave, Memorial 26657189, accessed May 15, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/26657189.
